channel.title: Drop Probability model
channel.description:
The issue at hand is this. What could i use as a universal way to control the average, max, min drop rate? The 3 colors in the middle are possible formula spreads. The only way i can think of is to have [i]n[/i] different "drop models" and specify an equation for each model. to make it simple. for [i]y = x[sup]2[/sup][/i](red line in picture) The simple parts: [i]y = A*(x-.5)[sup]2[/sup]+MIN[/i] A is what i do not know. The value that would make val(0) and val(1) to be MAX. I guess what i am asking, is how would i go about finding a value for A, for any value MAX.(a generic equation)
I guess this would be a good thing to put in a quiz lol. Okay- i may have been really dumb for this one i admit lol. A = (MAX-MIN)/(x-.5)[sup]2[/sup]| x = 0 or x = 1
Same question now: but doing it for a non uniform distribution.? f(x = 0) = MIN and f(x = 1) = MAX for[b] anything but[/b] a [b]linear function[/b](green line)
What i end up with example: y = A * (x-.5)[sup]1/3[/sup]+ MIN for max: MAX = A * (1-.5)[sup]1/3[/sup]+ MIN (MAX - MIN) = A*(0.5)[sup]1/3[/sup] (MAX-MIN)/(0.5)[sup]1/3[/sup] = A
Ok last time. Same question. but doing it for a multimodal distribution?
